item.title: Vice President, Business Consulting
item.description:
StackAdapt is one of the world’s leading advertising technology platforms built for modern marketers to execute results-driven programmatic media campaigns with ease. With the platform consistently ranked top of its class (#1 Demand-Side Platform on G2), the company is working with the most recognizable brands and advertising agencies across the globe.
We are building a Business Consulting Group to help our clients succeed in the increasingly competitive global economy, and we are looking for an entrepreneurial, ambitious person who is infinitely curious and loves taking the initiative to kick start and build the team.
StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in Canada or the US for this position.

item.title: UI/UX Engineer, Frontend Infrastructure
item.description:
StackAdapt is the #1 performing native advertising platform helping brands accelerate customer engagement and acquisition. This state-of-the-art platform is where some of the most progressive work in machine learning meets cutting-edge user experience.
Ranking the highest in performance by G2 Crowd for the fourth time, we're one of the fastest growing companies in Canada and ranks 6th in Deloitte's Technology Fast 50 ranking and 23rd in Fast 500 in North America.
We're seeking an UI/UX engineer to help enhance our existing component library. The digital advertising industry is riddled with interesting challenges as we continue to scale out our platform with a fast growing list of customers.
Our technologies include Ruby on Rails, Go, React, GraphQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, Amazon Redshift, and others. Watch our talk at Amazon Tech Talks: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lRqu-a4gPuU
StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in North America for this position.

item.title: Strategic Account Manager, Channel Partnerships
item.description:
Are you a proactive problem solver with a passion for programmatic advertising? Are you a relationship builder with strong interpersonal communication skills? If so, then we want to hear from you! We’re looking for a Strategic Account Manager (AM) to join our expanding Channel Partnerships team.
Reporting to the Manager of Client Services, you will play an integral role in both the pre- and post-sales client relations and lifecycle as it relates to user adoption of the StackAdapt platform, regular client communications and campaign management. In addition, you will work closely with your Channel Partnerships Account Executives as the technical voice when selling the value of the StackAdapt Platform as well as advise, design and help execute on simple to complex campaign setup strategies to meet a variety of KPI’s and universal business goals.
A successful AM at StackAdapt must have a strong understanding of our clients’ business objectives, and the ability to proactively communicate how new StackAdapt features and solutions can maximize the customer’s campaign ROI.
Curious to learn more? You can read about 'a day in the life of an Account Manager' on our blog.
StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in the US for this position.

item.title: Sr. Technical Business Analyst (North America)
item.description:
We are looking for an exceptional candidate who is interested in driving internal process innovation within one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Canada. In this role, you will be responsible for increasing organizational efficiency through business process optimization and automation. We are looking for a candidate who is looking for a fast-paced job where they can work independently in an environment that supports entrepreneurship and initiative.
As part of StackAdapt's Business Optimization team, you will be building process and technology solutions that help our employees thrive. You'll work collaboratively across our teams to design, build, and launch solutions that delight our employees. You'll make processes efficient, ship successful digital products before, and drive informed, data-driven action that ensures we design the right thing for our company.
Your responsibilities will be dynamic – you may be facilitating employee interviews to discover pain points, helping to improve our APIs with our engineers, or documenting processes. Ultimately, you should be able to create clarity out of ambiguity and guide teams to create high-quality experiences.
StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in North America for this position.

item.title: Senior FP&A Analyst
item.description:
We are immediately hiring an experienced Senior Financial Analyst, FP&A, to join our Financial Planning & Analysis team in London, UK.
The Senior Finance Analyst, FP&A, is responsible for partnering with functional leaders across the organisation and supporting our rapidly growing organisation. This key contributor will perform crucial budgeting, forecasting, and analysis to help the company’s financial health and business strategy. Reporting to the Director of FP&A, this role supports StackAdapt’s financial forecasting, planning, reporting and analysis efforts for the organisations.
The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset and experience driving business process improvement. In addition, they will have the ability and confidence to work cross-functionally, understand and communicate complex concepts, bring business insights, drive change, and produce tangible results. We are looking for an individual who is passionate about their work, a fast learner, hardworking, organised, detail-oriented, and ready to make a significant impact.

item.title: Senior Analyst, US Taxation
item.description:
StackAdapt is in an incredibly exciting phase of growth having recently doubled in employee size over the last year and having expanded its footprint outside of North America to establish a strong presence in the EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) and APAC (Asia-Pacific) regions.
We are looking for a Senior Analyst, US Taxation to support StackAdapt’s US tax expansion plans. Reporting to the Manager, Taxation & Treasury, and partnering with stakeholders across legal, finance and the business, the Senior Analyst, US Taxation will help solve various tax and business problems - in both a strategic and hands-on role. Rather than look for a candidate who knows it all, we are looking for a candidate that is interested in learning and excited to be part of a high growth technology company.
We are looking for a candidate who embodies the StackAdapt Values - bring positive energy, growth mindset, be adaptable, get sh*t done, be proud of your work!
StackAdapt is a Remote First company. This role is open to candidates located anywhere in Canada. Occasional travel may be required.

item.title: Programmatic Sales Manager (UAE)
item.description:
Are you passionate about digital advertising? Are you interested in building strong, meaningful client relations? Do you thrive under pressure and hustle to get things done? If so, we want to hear from you! We’re looking for a Senior Sales Manager to join our growing Revenue team.
The Sales Manager role is a combination of sales activities and customer relationship management. Are you a data-driven person with stellar analytical skills? Have you always been fascinated by digital advertising? Are you always looking for different ways to achieve better results? If so, we want to hear from you! We’re looking for a Campaign Manager to join our growing Revenue team.
Reporting to the Manager, Campaign Management, you’ll use your RTB/Programmatic media buying experience to optimize campaigns and come up with unique solutions that maximize our clients campaign ROI. Additionally, you’ll work closely with other revenue team members to recommend campaign strategies, ensure our clients are satisfied with their campaign performance, and identify portfolio growth opportunities.
StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in the West Region of the US for this position.

item.description:

item.title: Accounts Receivable Analyst, EMEA
item.description: We are looking for a talented AR Analyst to join our growing collections team and help meet the demands for our industry-leading programmatic advertising platform. The AR Analyst will work closely with our revenue team and help improve the integrity and strength of our billing and collections processes and balances. Our team consists of talented professionals who are passionate and can adapt to the fast-growing programmatic advertising industry. At StackAdapt, we instil a growth mindset and embrace your strengths and ambitions so you feel empowered. If you exude positive energy, are immensely driven, and can’t wait to join a growing team, apply below!

item.title: Account Executive (West)
item.description:
Are you passionate about digital advertising? Are you interested in building strong, meaningful client relations? Do you thrive under pressure and hustle to get things done? If so, we want to hear from you! We’re looking for an Account Executive (AE) to join our growing Revenue team.
The AE role is a combination of sales activities and customer relationship management. Reporting to the Sales Director, you’ll be responsible for both growing existing business and closing new programmatic advertising revenue from agencies and brands. A successful AE must have a clear understanding of the client’s long-term business objectives and seek partnership opportunities to further grow the client’s business with StackAdapt. You’ll work closely with StackAdapt Account Managers to grow and retain existing accounts by presenting new campaign strategies and solutions to clients, and building strong relationships.
StackAdapt Headquarters is located in Toronto, Canada but we primarily operate within the US market. We are looking for candidates based in the West to help us continue to penetrate key markets.
